alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cascade County through 300 PM MDT... At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Great Falls, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief heavy rain or snow. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Belt, Black Eagle, Malmstrom Afb, Eden, Sand Coulee, Stockett, Tracy and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains
